alert.note: Alert for Fluvanna; Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 8:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Fluvanna and Louisa. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 PM EDT, Minor flooding is likely occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier this evening. While the heavy rain has ended, the threat for flooding will continue for at least another hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palmyra, Troy, Kents Store, Ferncliff, Wildwood, Wilmington, Bybee, Carysbrook, Cunningham, Zion Crossroads, Dixie, Central Plains, Cohasset and Byrd Mill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
